member.summary: Cache only

member.summary: Directs DNS to ignore the local name.

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.DnsException
member.summary: Represents the exception that occurs when a fails.

remarks.para: The exception that occurs when a DNS request fails at any level.

This class is used to represent two broad types of exceptions:
Win32 API Exceptions that occurred when calling the DnsQuery API
Exceptions of other types that occurred when working with the and classes.
Win32 errors that are DNS specific are specified in the enumeration but if the returned is not defined in that enum then the number returned will be defined in WinError.h.
Exceptions of other types are available through the InnerException property.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of
member.remarks: Used to raise a with all the default properties. The message property will return: Unspecified DNS exception.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of
member.param: the human readable description of the problem
member.remarks: Used to raise a where the only important information is a description about the error. The property will return 0 or SUCCESS indicating that the DNS API calls succeeded, regardless of whether they did or did not.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsException.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of
member.param: the human readable description of the problem
the error code () if the DnsQuery api failed
member.remarks: Used to raise a where the underlying DNS API call fails. In this case, the property is the most important information about the exception. In most cases, the number returned is a value in the enum however, if it is not, the error is defined in WinError.h.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of
member.param: the human readable description of the problem
the exception that caused the underlying error
member.remarks: Used to raise a where the exception is some other type but a typeof(DnsException) is desired to be raised instead. In this case, the property always returns 0 or SUCCESS and is a useless property.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of for
member.remarks: Used by the interface.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsException.ErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the error code () if the DnsQuery api failed. Will be set to success (0) if the API didn't fail but another part of the code did.
member.remarks: Win32 errors that are DNS specific are specified in the enumeration but if the returned is not defined in that enum then the number returned will be defined in WinError.h.
member.value: Value will be defined in WinError.h if not defined in the enum.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsWrapper.Equals(netlib.Dns.DnsRecordType)
member.summary: Determines whether or not this instance is equal to a specific by comparing the property of the current against the argument.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether or not this object contains a DNS record matching the entered type.
member.remarks: Determines if this is of a specific . The comparison does not test the field.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsWrapper.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether or not this instance is equal to another or to a instance.
member.param: The object to compare to this instance.
member.returns: A boolean indicating whether or not this object equals the entered object.
member.remarks: Determines if this instance is equal to an object. If the object is a , the method is used to determine equality based on the record type. If the object is a object, the method is used to determine equality. If the object is any other type, the class's Equal method is used for comparison.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsWrapper.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table.
member.returns: Integer value representing the hashcode of this instance of .
member.remarks: The GetHashCode method uses the hash codes of the and properties to generate a unique code for this particular record type/data combination.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsWrapper.CompareTo(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares the current instance with another object of the same type.
member.param: The object to compare with this instance.
member.returns:
A 32-bit signed integer that indicates the relative order of the comparands. The return value has these meanings:
Value Meaning
Less than zero This instance is less than obj. The types do not match.
Zero This instance is equal to obj.
Greater than zero This instance is greater than obj. The do not match.
member.remarks: Compares a to this instance by its and properties.
member.exception: obj is not the same type as this instance.

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.DnsWrapperCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of objects.
member.remarks: The DnsWrapperCollection is a collection of objects. The resultant collection represents all of the DNS records for the given domain that was looked up. This class cannot be directly created - it is created by the and classes to hold the returned DNS records for the given domain.

member.summary: Gets the at the specified ordinal in the collection
member.remarks: Gets the at the specified index of the collection.
member.param: The index to retrieve from the collection.
member.value: The at the specified index of the collection.

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest
member.summary: Represents one DNS request. Allows for a complete DNS record lookup on a given _Domain using the Windows API.

remarks.para: The DnsRequest class represents a complete DNS request for a given _Domain on a specified DNS server, including all options. The DnsRequest class uses the Windows API to do the query and the dlls used are only found on Windows 2000 or higher machines. The class will throw a exception if run on an machine not capable of using the APIs that are required.
Created by: Bill Gearhart. Based on code by Patrik Lundin. See version 1.0 remarks below. Specific attention was given to the exposed interface which got a 110% overhaul.

Notable changes from the previous version:
structs filled with constants were changed to enums
.net datatypes were changed to c# datatypes
every object is now in it's own *.cs file
custom collections and exceptions added
better object orientation - request and response classes created for the dns query request/response session so that it follows the .NET model
eliminated duplicate recs returned by an ALL query
bad api return code enumeration added
ToString() overridden to provide meaningful info for many of the dns data structs
documentation and notes were created for all classes
added check to ensure code only runs on w2k or better
obsolete DNS record types are now marked as such
newer enum values added to DnsQueryType enum
compiled html documentation was written which always takes 20 times longer than writing the code does.
this list of changes was compiled by your's truly...
smoothed out object and member names so they were more intuitive - for instance: DNS_MX_DATA became MXRecord
added call to DnsRecordListFree API to free resources after DnsQuery call
altered DnsQuery API call to allow for servers other than the local DNS server from being queried

Based on code found at: http://www.c-sharpcorner.com/Code/2002/April/DnsResolver.asp
Initial implementation.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.DnsQuery(System.String,netlib.Dns.DnsRecordType,netlib.Dns.DnsQueryType,System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/en-us/dns/dns/dnsquery.asp

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.DnsRecordListFree(System.IntPtr,netlib.Dns.DnsFreeType)
member.summary: http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/en-us/dns/dns/dnsrecordlistfree.asp

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of
member.remarks: The property is set to null and all other properties have their default value of false, except for which has a value of true. The system is set to use the local DNS server for all queries.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of
member.remarks: The property is set to the domain argument and all other properties have their default value of false, except for which has a value of true. The system is set to use the local DNS server for all queries.
member.param: The hostname that DNS information is desired for. This should not be an ip address. For example: yahoo.com

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.GetResponse(netlib.Dns.DnsRecordType)
member.summary: Queries the local DNS server for information about this instance of and returns the response as a
member.returns: A object containing the response from the DNS server.
member.exception: The code is running on a machine lesser than Windows 2000
The DNS query itself failed or parsing of the returned response failed
member.remarks: Returns a representing the response from the DNS server or one of the exceptions noted in the exceptions area, the most common of which is the .

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.UseTCPOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to use TCP only for the query.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to use TCP instead of UDP for the query
member.remarks: If set to true, the DNS query will be done via TCP rather than UDP. This is useful if the DNS service you are trying to reach is running on TCP but not on UDP.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.AcceptTruncatedResponse
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to accept truncated results â€” does not retry under TCP.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to accept truncated results.
member.remarks: Determines wherher or not the server will be re-queried in the event that a response was truncated.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.NoRecursion
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to perform an iterative query
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to use recursion to resolve the query.
member.remarks: Specifically directs the DNS server not to perform recursive resolution to resolve the query.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.BypassCache
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to bypass the resolver cache on the lookup.
member.remarks: Setting this to true allows you to specify one or more DNS servers to query instead of querying the local DNS cache and server. If false is set, the list of servers is ignored and the local DNS cache and server is used to resolve the query.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.QueryCacheOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to direct DNS to perform a query on the local cache only
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to only use the DNS cache to resolve a query.
member.remarks: This option allows you to query the local DNS cache only instead of making a DNS request over either UDP or TCP. This property represents the logical opposite of the property.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.WireOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to direct DNS to perform a query using the network only, bypassing local information.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to use the network only instead of local information.
member.remarks: This property represents the logical opposite of the property.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.NoLocalName
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to direct DNS to ignore the local name.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to ignore the local name.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS query handles local names.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.NoHostsFile
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to prevent the DNS query from consulting the HOSTS file.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to deny access to the HOSTS file when querying.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS query handles accessing the HOSTS file when querying for DNS information.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.NoNetbt
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to prevent the DNS query from using NetBT for resolution.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to deny access to NetBT during the query.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS query handles accessing NetBT when querying for DNS information.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.QueryReturnMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to direct DNS to return the entire DNS response message.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to return the entire response.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS query expects the response to be received from the server.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.TreatAsFQDN
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to prevent the DNS response from attaching suffixes to the submitted name in a name resolution process.
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to allow suffix attachment during resolution.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS server handles suffix appending to the submitted name during name resolution.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest.DontResetTTLValues
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not to store records with the TTL corresponding to the minimum value TTL from among all records
member.value: Boolean indicating whether or not to use TTL values from all records.
member.remarks: Determines how the DNS query handles TTL values.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsRequest._domain
member.summary: Gets or sets the _Domain to query. The _Domain must be a hostname, not an IP address.
member.remarks: This method is expecting a hostname, not an IP address. The system will fail with a when is called if _domain is an IP address.
member.value: String representing the _Domain that DNS information is desired for. This should be set to a hostname and not an IP Address.

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse
member.summary: Represents one DNS response. This class cannot be directly created - it is returned by the method.
member.remarks: The DnsResponse class represents the information returned by a DNS server in response to a . The DnsResponse class offers easy access to all of the returned DNS records for a given domain.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse.GetRecords(netlib.Dns.DnsRecordType)
member.summary: Returns a collection of DNS records of a specified . The collection's data type is determined by the type of record being sought in the type argument.
member.param: A enumeration value indicating the type of DNS record to get from the list of all DNS records (available in the property.
member.returns: an of one of the types specified in the namespace based on the argument representing the type of DNS record desired.
member.remarks:
It is recommended that you loop through the results of this method as follows for maximum convenience:
foreach ( record in obj.GetRecords()) { string s = record.ToString(); }
The following table indicates the DNS record type you can expect to get back based on the requested. Any items returning null are not currently supported.
DnsRecordType enumeration value GetRecords() returns
A
CNAME
PTR
MX
SRV
TEXT

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse.RawRecords
member.summary: Gets a containing all of the DNS information that the server returned about the queried domain.
member.remarks: Returns all of the DNS records retrieved about the domain as a . This property is wrapped by the method.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse.SRVRecords
member.summary: Gets all the for the queried domain.
member.remarks: Uses the method to retrieve an array of s representing all the Address records for the domain.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse.TXTRecords
member.summary: Gets all the for the queried domain.
member.remarks: Uses the method to retrieve an array of s representing all the Address records for the domain.

member.name: P:netlib.Dns.DnsResponse.MXRecords
member.summary: Gets all the for the queried domain.
member.remarks: Uses the method to retrieve an array of s representing all the Mail Exchanger records for the domain.

The string returned looks like:
string count: [COUNT] string array: [ARR] where [COUNT] = string representation of and [ARR] = string representation of

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord
member.summary: Represents a DNS Server record. (DNS_SRV_DATA)
member.remarks: The SRVRecord structure is used in conjunction with the and classes to programmatically manage DNS entries.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.NameNext
member.summary: Gets or sets the name
member.remarks: Pointer to a string representing the target host.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority
member.remarks: Priority of the target host specified in the owner name. Lower numbers imply higher priority.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.Weight
member.summary: Gets or sets the weight
member.remarks: Weight of the target host. Useful when selecting among hosts with the same priority. The chances of using this host should be proportional to its weight.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port
member.remarks: Port used on the terget host for the service.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.Pad
member.summary: Reserved.
member.remarks: Reserved. Used to keep pointers DWORD aligned.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.Records.SRVRecord.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this record.
member.remarks:
The string returned looks like:
name next: [SERVER] priority: [PRIOR] weight: [WEIGHT] port: [PORT] where [SERVER] = string representation of and [PRIOR] = string representation of and [WEIGHT] = string representation of and [PORT] = string representation of

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord
member.summary: Represents a DNS Start Of Authority record (DNS_SOA_DATA)
member.remarks: The SOARecord structure is used in conjunction with the and classes to programmatically manage DNS entries.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.PrimaryServer
member.summary: Gets or sets the primary server
member.remarks: Pointer to a string representing the name of the authoritative DNS server for the zone to which the record belongs.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.Administrator
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the administrator
member.remarks: Pointer to a string representing the name of the responsible party for the zone to which the record belongs.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.SerialNo
member.summary: Gets or sets the serial number
member.remarks: Serial number of the SOA record.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.Refresh
member.summary: Gets or sets the refresh
member.remarks: Time, in seconds, before the zone containing this record should be refreshed.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.Retry
member.summary: Gets or sets the retry count
member.remarks: Time, in seconds, before retrying a failed refresh of the zone to which this record belongs

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.Expire
member.summary: Gets or sets the expiration
member.remarks: Time, in seconds, before an unresponsive zone is no longer authoritative.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.DefaultTtl
member.summary: Gets or sets the default ttl
member.remarks: Lower limit on the time, in seconds, that a DNS server or caching resolver are allowed to cache any RRs from the zone to which this record belongs.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.Records.SOARecord.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the Start Of Authority record.
member.remarks:
The string returned looks like:
administrator: [ADMIN] TTL: [TTL] primary server: [SERVER] refresh: [REFRESH] retry: [RETRY] serial number: [SERIAL] where [ADMIN] = string representation of and [TTL] = string representation of and [SERVER] = string representation of and [REFRESH] = string representation of and [RETRY] = string representation of and [SERIAL] = string representation of

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.Records.PTRRecord
member.summary: Represents the DNS pointer record (DNS_PTR_DATA)
member.remarks: The PTRRecord structure is used in conjunction with the and classes to programmatically manage DNS entries.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.PTRRecord.HostName
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname of the record.
member.remarks: Pointer to a string representing the pointer (PTR) record data.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.Records.PTRRecord.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the pointer record.
member.remarks:
The string returned looks like:
Hostname: [HOST] where [HOST] = string representation of

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.Records.MXRecord
member.summary: Represents a DNS Mail Exchange record (DNS_MX_DATA).
member.remarks: The MXRecord structure is used in conjunction with the and classes to programmatically manage DNS entries.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.MXRecord.Exchange
member.summary: Gets or sets the exchange's host name
member.remarks: Pointer to a string representing the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the host willing to act as a mail exchange.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.MXRecord.Preference
member.summary: Gets or sets the preference of the exchange.
member.remarks: Preference given to this resource record among others at the same owner. Lower values are preferred.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.MXRecord.Pad
member.summary: Reserved.
member.remarks: Reserved. Used to keep pointers DWORD aligned.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.Records.MXRecord.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of this mail exchange.
member.remarks:
The string returned looks like:
exchange (preference): [EXCH] ([PREF]) where [EXCH] = string representation of and [PREF] = hexadecimal representation of

member.name: T:netlib.Dns.Records.ARecord
member.summary: Represents a DNS Address record (DNS_A_DATA)
member.remarks: The ARecord structure is used in conjunction with the and classes to programmatically manage DNS entries.

member.name: F:netlib.Dns.Records.ARecord.Address
member.summary: Gets or sets the ip address.
member.remarks: IPv4 address, in the form of an uint datatype. could be used to fill this property.

member.name: M:netlib.Dns.Records.ARecord.ToString
